title.narrative: Providing Analytical Services for Informed Farming in Kenya (PASIFIK)

description.narrative: The PASIFIK project aims to make soil and feed analysis and related fertilizing and feeding advice widely available to (smallholder) farmers. These services, based on proven technology in Europe, will be easily accessible to farmers by use of mobile field laboratories that will visit organized farmers in their own area, and by charging low prices. The program will entail the calibration of the European technology to the Kenyan context and the development and testing of the mobile field labs. Franchise takers will be identified: local entrepreneurs that will manage the field lab system. And as this system is established large scale awareness campaigns and training programs will educate farmers on soil and feed management and the benefits of testing, thus creating a market for this innovative service. As a result of this program, farmers will be enabled to make informed decisions on field and feed management which will lead to increased productivity and efficiency. Their farm systems will become more sustainable as nutrient losses and emissions of greenhouse gasses are reduced. Local entrepreneurship will be promoted as farmers will rationalize their businesses, the market for quality fertilizers and feed will grow and as the franchise system will create local jobs.
